IOWA STATE COLLEGE OF AGRICULTURE AND MECHANIC ARTS
RADIO-TELEVISION SERVICE
WOI WOI-FM WOI-TV
AMES. IOWA
September 2, 1952
Graydon Ausraus, Director
Radio-Broadcasting Services
Manager, WUOA (FM)
University of Alabama
University, Alabama
Dear Graydon:
Many thanks for your kind and thoughtful letters of August 25th.
It was particularly thoughtful of you to write Dr. Friley and I
genuinely appreciate your comments about the staff and the station.
I will be very interested in hearing whatever develops with respect
to the Committee and the executive director situation. I have been
giving this a lot of thought and the whole situation, for a matter
of fact, and will have same ideas I would like to express to you on
the telephone or in writing sometime next week, on matters other than
the executive director.
What it amounts to is this, I think our all-time high priority at
Minneapolis is getting ourselves put together as a total unit so that
no committees, sub-functions, headquarters, trips, plans and dreams
are conceived in a matter which is unrelated to the basic activities
of NAEB. Where this is the case they should be reintegrated with our
going activity.
The foregoing sounds like a fine and beautiful speech but nonetheless
I think it is very much to the point at the present time for a good
many reasons.
Best regards.
Sincerely,
Richard B. Hull
Radio-TV Director
